Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: Hello, everyone. As I've read, "The 5% reward starts accumulating after a few minutes if you hold over 10 KMD in your wallet. " So, if I've over 10 KMD in my mobile wallet, that's all I have to do?

Author: adriendarki#8952
Content: hello all

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @Tanya Lya Yes. Send over 10 KMD and wait for an hour (60 blocks). Make sure your tx displays locktime in explorer

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Hello @adriendarki

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content:
Ok, I found more info in Komodo's FAQ: "As users know, the more transactions there are on a blockchain the more difficult it is to conduct timing analysis. Over the past year, we have measured the need for even more active movement in order to better support the KMD privacy mechanism. To implement this, the annual time limit on the growing of 5% will be changed to monthly cap of 5%/12. What this means is that you will need to actively use all your funds every month to maximize your rewards for contributing to the activity of the KMD ecosystem. The good news is that compounding will get you rewards of 5.1% over a year. For users that do it just 4 times, it will end up a bit less than 2%. Your contribution to the privacy ecosystem will be more closely linked to your reward.
KMD holders actively earn a 5.1% compound KMD reward annually by holding more than 10 KMD and collecting the 5%/12 reward once every month."  - so does this all mean that I should perform an operation with my KMD funds every month? What exactly does it mean - "actively use all your funds"?

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: @SHossain thanks for the answer. Could you please also answer the next question? I found more info which made me a bit more confused

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: You need to make at least one transaction every month. Either to yourself or to another address in order to keep accruing rewards.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: That is starting in a week

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: @SHossain ah, I see. Does the value of monthly transactions matter?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: nope. best is to send all to self

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: do you use Agama?

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: No, I use Guarda

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: And what if I miss 1 month, but make 2 transactions the other month?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: After 1 month the reward will stop accruing until you claim them. then it will stop again in 1 month from the time of the last tx

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: check your address or txid in the explorer

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: or post your address here and i can check

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: @SHossain 4fc4208ddec64447c65b0f28b08af9f99be4c00c8d7b633a3d4671d5659493d3

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you are not accruing rewards at the moment. LockTime is not set https://kmdexplorer.io/tx/4fc4208ddec64447c65b0f28b08af9f99be4c00c8d7b633a3d4671d5659493d3

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: did you send the funds from an exchange?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you can send all of them again to your same address. and check the txid in explorer if you see LockTime for the tx.

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: @SHossain I sent them from the web wallet of Guarda

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: ok

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: send all of them again to the same address from mobile

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: you mean, resend them from the mobile wallet where they are now to the same mobile wallet address?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: yes

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: that may set the locktime. in that case, your funds will start accruing rewards

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: yeah, but I can't just resend them from the mobile wallet to itself. I can only send it back to the web wallet, and from there resend it to the mobile. Will it work?

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: and, actually, isn't that the locktime already set in the tx? https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mXoTPSn-gijJcAa9wANfj1249yxkwEnH/view?usp=sharing 12:23:13

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: did you actually check the link i shared above? if you already sent from web wallet which didn't set locktime, why do you want to do it again?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: the mobile wallet should allow you to send funds to any valid address. you just need to send all funds to `RSvQTFsEThi5vDhcZ9UqVFmd6QkgqUJVBM` which is your address as you mentioned

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: no, sorry, I missed the link. Now that I opened it it still doesn't make a lot of sense üò©  I mean, if they're already in my mobile wallet, how can I resend them to the same address?

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: @Tanya Lya 'LockTime' is an option setting that is independent from what time a tx was transmitted and/or put into a block

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: when used, it is what determines how old a tx is in order to get a reward

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: when not used, there's no reward because the reward is based on that timestamp

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: @ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢ hello, thanks. And how can I turn on this option setting?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @Tanya Lya can you send KMD using the wallet to any other KMD address?

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: hmm, I see two options. Option 1 - I could resend it to my web wallet and resend it back to my mobile wallet. Option 2 - I could ask a friend to receive a transfer from me and send it back to my mobile wallet

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: where do you see these 2 options only?

Author: Tanya Lya#2332
Content: in my mind )

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: don't use Option 1

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: use option 2

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: or use Agama Lite mode to create a new address, send the funds there and back to your Guarda wallet
